intro: Crassocephalum ruwenzoriense, commonly known as the Ruwenzori sunflower, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It is characterized by its large, yellow-orange daisy-like flowers and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants. Its striking appearance makes it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
